page.title: 07ST. JAMES' CHURCH TOWER.
page.content: St. James' Church tower has a ring of ten bells.Seven of these were given by St.Alkmund Church ,Derby.The other three were cast from the original bell of St. James'.The oldest bell was cast in 1684.This ring of bells was dedicated on 18th.December,1978 by the Bishop of Derby.New steel joists had to be put in the tower to replace the old wooden ones. The bells are rung by means of ropes which are attached to wheels.The ropes have thick woollen pieces called 'sallys'.This is the part which the bell-ringers pull.The other end of the rope is called the "tail-end".The bells are rung on special occasions, such as weddings and funerals and on Church Festivals.People come from all over the world to ring these bells.
